page.title: 02WOODSPRING PRIORY
page.content: The building of the priory began in the thirteenth century.The site,which covers two acres,has seen two churches-the first one was burned.The Priory is now looked after by the Landmark Trust and is open every day of the year. The ancient building is undergoing renovation.It houses a small museum and ,we are told two ghosts:one,a lady,walks in the garden on the full moon and the other who hovers and clanks chains in the church. A spiral staircase made of 97 stone steps leads to the top of the tower which is 65 feet above ground level. Sheep graze in the peaceful orchard of the Priory and there is a tythe-barn nearby which belongs to the Priory.
